column5: What do you look for to identify post spawn areas?
Depends on water temps. clarity, depth, light conditions, and time of day. Green weeds a good start.
Post spawns spots are were you find the wally's. Just put your boat in the water try deep, try shallow and if that doesn'r work try in between.
You can't go wrong in green weeds. Find the deeper edges and work them slow.  S.
I think that all depends on the lake... Personally in the kawarthas this time of year i catch most of my fish between 8-12 fow.  Like mentioned above green weeds!
